alert.note: Alert for Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:57PM EST until December 19 at 3:25AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Wells River At Wells River affecting Orange County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wells River at Wells River. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Water approaches US Highway 302 along the Wells River in Groton, South Ryegate, and Wells River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM EST Monday was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
